creator: White, Thomas, 1830-1888. (author)
Foster, George Eulas (Sir), 1847-1931. (author)
description: White, Thomas: 1830-1888. Born and educated in Montreal; journalist; founded and operated Peterborough Review, 1853-1860; founded Hamilton Spectator, 1864; immigration agent in England for Canada, 1869; assumed control of Montreal Gazette, 1870; elected to House of Commons, 1878-1888; Minister of the Interior, 1885-1888 and thus responsible for reorganizing government of North West Territories after the second Riel Rebellion (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography). // Foster, George Eulas (Sir): 1847-1931. Born and educated in New Brunswick; professor of Classics at University of New Brunswick, 1873-1879; in House of Commons, 1882-1900, 1904-1921; in Senate, 1921-1931; created K.C.M.G. (1912) and G.C.M.G. (1918) (Wallace, Dictionary of Canadian biography).

title: Two great speeches: Hon. Thos. White on the alleged half-breed grievances: Hon. Geo. E. Foster on the national policy, the debt, and the Riel issue: Delivered in the City Hall, London, Ont., Saturday, Dec. 18, 1886
